title: (x) Christopher Farr logo extended sans - PL Brazilia {Yves}
content:
Here is yet another logo in which I can’t figure out what the font is?

[http://www.christopherfarr.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907003650/http:/www.christopherfarr.com/ "http://www.christopherfarr.com/")

Mikey

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907003650im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/logo10_4264.gif)

 [‹ (x) Laura Ashley "Here to inspire you" script - Lady Dawn {Rainer}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907003650/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31254 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) text serif in "A Prior" art journal - Baskerville 1757 {Yves} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907003650/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31183 "Go to next forum topic")
author: SuperUltraFabulous

comments.content:
Thank you... they extended it... and the lowercase ’a’ threw me off.

Mikey ;-)

Naw, it’s the delicious [Brazilia Seven](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907003650/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=C.106281.0.2&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=Christopher+Farr&sampleSize=24), possibly my favouritest extended Grotesque.

Very delicious. Did you mean grotesque or Grotesque? ;^)

Grot

Hehehehe, I don’t know why i keep capitalising that. :^P

BTW Lari, you are indeed my favouritest Grotesque, although I wouldn’t know if you’re extended or not. Me I’m more on the condensed side.

Thanks Yves: I have never seen that typeface in my life and I do like it much. There was ad for Christopher Farr rugs in upscale interior design magazine and I have to say it looked pretty good in that setting. The FontFont site listed this font as PL Brazilia. Any idea what this means or who the designer(s) is?

Thanks,

Mike Diaz

PS......

“BTW Lari, you are indeed my favouritest Grotesque, although I wouldn’t know if you’re extended or not. Me I’m more on the condensed side.”  
Get a room guys. ;-)
